She has coppery skin, and grew up in Arad Doman. She has a stubborn set to her mouth, but she is warm to Egwene. She swore, of her own volition, to obey Egwene, and spied on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin) for a time. She was subsequently sent as part of an embassy to the Black Tower and has not been seen since.

name: Thomdril (Thom) Merrilin
info: Gleeman who came to Emond's Field on Winternight just before the Trollocs came. He is quite the ladies' man. Thom is very good at juggling, sleight-of-hand, and all kinds of other tricks—[Rodel Ituralde](#Lord-Rodel-Ituralde) once saw him performing at the Royal Court, and to say that he was impressed was to say that the sun is hot. He also carries several concealed knives up his sleeves, in his boots, and in various other locations on his body; this practice seems to have spread from Thom to [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Min](#Elmindreda-Min-Farshaw), and [Faile](#Faile-ni-Bashere-t-Aybara). Thom was originally a bard in [Queen Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand)'s Royal Court, and for a time after her husband [Taringail Damodred](#Taringail-Damodred) died, he was the Queen's lover. During his run from a Fade at Shadar Logoth, he was injured, and now walks with a limp because of it. Thom is getting old, such that he is starting to realize that he cannot do the backflips and other stunts he used to do. He accompanied [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand) and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) on their travels as per [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred)'s request, despite the fact that he has never felt comfortable around Aes Sedai since his nephew, Owyn, was gentled by the Red Ajah. Thom is an expert in the Game of Houses; in fact, his girlfried Dena was killed by Cairhienin soldiers because they thought he was trying to play _Daes Daemar_ against the Royal House. He has recently taken to traveling with Mat and his entourage, ever since hooking up with him again in Ebou Dar. Thom received a letter from [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) after her battle with [Lanfear](#Lanfear) stating that she was still alive in the land of the Eelfinn. He and Mat have plans to attempt rescue.

name: Thulin
info: Blacksmith in [Renald Fanwar](#Renald-Fanwar)'s village. He is lean, for a blacksmith. He wears his hair in the Shienaran style, but without the topknot. He is old, with gray hair, and thin. He has brown eyes. He and Fanwar often play stones together, but his most recent trip to Fanwar's house was to tell him to pack up and leave to confront the Shadow.

name: Thurasa
info: One of [Graendal](#Graendal)'s prized pets. She used to be a member of the Domani Merchants Council.

name: Tiam of Gazar
info: Person who proposed the Gazaran Calendar, which celebrated the alleged freedom from the Trolloc threat by recording Free Years (FY). This calendar was adopted due to the chaos the resulted during the Trolloc Wars and the resulting confusion as to which year it actually was under the Toman Calendar.

name: Tiana Noselle
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She serves as [Mistress of Novices](#Mistress-of-Novices) among the Aes Sedai who fled the White Tower. She is short and slight, and has large brown eyes and a dimple. She looks young despite her ageless Aes Sedai features.

name: Tijds
info: Soldier who alerts [Gareth Bryne](#Gareth-Bryne) to the Seanchan attack on the Tower.

name: Timolan
info: Clan Chief of the Miagoma Aiel. When he was young as a chief, he tried to unite the clans and failed. Other chiefs thought he might be a little hesitant to follow a man who had succeeded in doing just that. He grates at [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor)'s arrogance. He vowed that if Rand abandoned the Aiel, the Miagoma would go back to the Three Fold Land—_after_ he sees Rand al'Thor dead. Wise Ones have recently been sent to convince Timolan _not_ to return to the Three-Fold Land.

name: Tod al'Caar
info: Young man from the Two Rivers. He is about a year younger than [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), and now serves as one of his bannermen. He has a heavy jaw.

name: Toma dur Ahmid
info: Person who devised the Toman Calendar, which was adopted approximately two hundred years after the death of the last male Aes Sedai and continued until the Trolloc Wars. The Calendar recorded years After the Breaking, or AB.

name: Tomas
info: Warder bonded to [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin). He is stocky, has gray hair, and is old and haggard though still quite spry.

name: Torhs Margin
info: Man from the Age of Legends. He once made the mistake of underestimating [Graendal](#Graendal), and history records his unpleasant fate that resulted. He is also known as Torhs the Broken.

name: Triben
info: Hawk-faced Saldaean soldier with a short, trimmed mustache and a scar across his forehead.

name: Tsutama Rath
info: Golden-haired Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. Born of a butcher, she is extremely flamboyant and has no fewer than three clocks in her rooms. She has an extreme dislike of men. Tsutama resigned as a Sitter fifteen years ago and went into “voluntary” retreat after participating in the “disgusting events” of twenty years ago. When she returned, she was perceived as nervous and shifty, but now that she has been raised to the head of the Red Ajah (their Highest), that perception has been revealed to be incorrect.

name: Turese
chapter: Chapter 39: A Visit from Verin Sedai
info: Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah. She is young enough not to have the ageless look. She was assigned to guard [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) after she was released from her cell (during [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin)'s visit).

name: Uren din Jubai Soaring Gull
info: Sea Folk scholar and deviser of the [Farede](#Panarch-Farede) Calendar, which measured dates from the arbitrarily set end of the War of the Hundred Years as years of the New Era (NE). This calendar is currently in use.

name: Varilin
info: Red-haired Sitter for the Gray Ajah in the Hall of the Tower-in-exile. She is inches taller than most men, and skinny. She sits on [Romanda](#Romanda-Cassin)'s side. She has been the leader of the not-too-serious negotiations with the White Tower.

name: Vasha
chapter: Chapter 13: An Offer and a Departure
info: Aes Sedai of the Green. She is Domani, and is very pretty with long black hair and striking green eyes. Her Warder is [Marlesh](#Marlesh).

name: Velina Behar
chapter: Chapter 39: A Visit from Verin Sedai
info: Sitter for the White Ajah in Tar Valon. She is cool and precise, has an almost girlishly high-pitched voice, a beak of a nose, and sharp, tilted eyes. She is a model of a White sister. [Verin](#Verin-Mathwin)'s work revealed that she is of the Black Ajah. She escaped [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere)'s justice.

name: Verin Mathwin
info: Aes Sedai of the Brown Ajah who accompanied [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), [Elayne](#Elayne-Trakand), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) back from Falme to Tar Valon. Her Warder is named [Tomas](#Tomas). She is more interested in current events than the average Brown; most of them could not care less what happened now, only what happened years ago. She gave Egwene the twisted stone ring _ter'angreal_ to assist her in Dreaming, and also once told [Morgase](#Morgase-Trakand) that there was really no need to keep her in the Tower until she learned to control her ability when she was a novice, since she would never be able to do much with it anyway. When Verin went to the Two Rivers with [Alanna](#Alanna-Mosvani), they helped to fight the Trollocs that attacked, and when they left they brought a half-dozen young women with them who could channel, including [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon)'s sister Bode. When she and Alanna reached Caemlyn, they found that the Tower had been broken, and decided to side with the Salidar embassy when it reached town. Verin is quite old—her hair is starting to turn gray, which to an Aes Sedai means she is quite old indeed. She communicated with [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin)'s group of sisters in Tear, but has since departed their company. Verin always seems to follow her own agenda, though [Siuan](#Siuan-Sanche) once said she had always trusted her, even though she knew she could trust no one. She and Thomas have been waiting for Mat for some time; she is the one who posted fliers of him and [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara) throughout the countryside, hoping to scare one of them up.

name: Veshir
info: One of [Fanwar](#Renald-Fanwar)'s farm hands. He is the oldest of them, and the first one Fanwar hired; he has been in his service for fifteen years. He is a good man, if hot-headed at times.

name: Vestas
info: One of the soldiers in [Gareth Bryne](#Gareth-Bryne)'s army.

name: Vitalien
info: [Sarene](#Sarene-Nemdahl)'s Warder. She left him in Cairhien when she left for Far Madding and later Shadar Logoth, but he is now following her and is in the city of Tear.

name: Vora
info: Owner or creator of the white fluted _sa'angreal_ [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) borrows from the Tower stores to fight the Seanchan. The same _sa'angreal_ was used by [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche), then the [Amyrlin](#The-Amyrlin-Seat) seat, to separate [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon) from the dagger he took from Shadar Logoth. It is the most powerful _sa'angreal_ the Tower has in its stores.

name: Wind
info: [Olver](#Olver)'s horse. He deserves the name; he is quite quick, and wins most of the races he runs.

name: Yeteri
info: Petite blonde novice in the White Tower. She was part of the circle [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) used to fight the Seanchan.

name: Young Bull
info: Name the wolves use for [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara). It is actually an image, one of the simpler ones in fact, but much more complex than simply “Young Bull.”

name: Yukiri
info: Aes Sedai of the Gray Ajah. She is quite small, and is a Sitter for the Gray. She was the daughter of an innkeeper, and is always the last Gray to join the Gray consensus in the Hall. She is now an ally of [Saerin](#Saerin-Asnobar) and [Pevara](#Pevara-Tazanovni) in hunting down Darkfriends in the Tower. She is one of the shortest people [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) has ever met. She always seems to be in control.

name: Yuril
info: Sharp-nosed man who people think is [Tuon](#High-Lady-Tuon-Athaem-Kore-Paendrag)'s secretary. He is, but he also commands her Seekers of the Truth, as her Hand.

name: Zanica
chapter: Chapter 39: A Visit from Verin Sedai

name: al'Lan Mandragoran
chapter: Chapter 7: The Plan for Arad Doman
info: The uncrowned king of Malkier, and formerly Warder to [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred). He is quite tall, and does not get very emotional—in fact, he has emotional walls all around him that he has been building for years. His country, Malkier, was overrun by Trollocs shortly after he was born, and is now corrupted by the Great Blight. Lan, among the last of his people, then proceeded to fight a one-man war against the Shadow by killing Shadowspawn in the Blight. He fought Aiel during the Aiel War, and achieved Blademaster status. He was eventually bonded by Moiraine, which ended his lonely fight (or at least changed its style). When Lan and Moiraine brought [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor), [Mat](#Matrim-Mat-Cauthon), [Perrin](#Perrin-t-Bashere-Aybara), [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere), and [Nynaeve](#el-Nynaeve-ti-al-Meara-Mandragoran) out of their home in the Two Rivers, he found that there was something which could throw his guard down, but he was the last to notice it: affection for Nynaeve. As Moiraine put it, Nynaeve was able to plant vines in Lan's emotional walls and break them down without him even knowing they were there. The two of them are now married. According to the terms of their vows as taken before the Sea Folk, one of them must obey in public while the other obeys in private; for obvious reasons, Nynaeve is the one who commands in public. Upon Moiraine's death, Lan's bond was immediately transferred to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) until Nynaeve is ready to have his bond transferred to her. Myrelle tried to keep Lan's status secret, but she was given away when she tried to buy one of Lan's favorite foods, coin peppers, too far south (they are very popular in Shienar, and were in Malkier before it fell to the Blight, but do not grow well in southern climates). Upon learning of where Lan was, [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) sent him to Ebou Dar to serve as a Warder for Nynaeve. He traveled with his wife and the group of Aes Sedai she accompanies until he started to feel longing for his homeland. Nynaeve understood that he needed to finish his fight in the Blight, but she vowed to increase his chance of survival by dropping him off at World's End in Saldaea and alerting every surviving Malkieri she could find that Lan was marching for Tarwin's Gap. According to the Wise Ones, _Aan'allein_ (as the Aiel call him) will die the day he learns that Nynaeve is dead. He is one of the best, if not _the_ best, warriors, swordsmen, and Warders in the world.

name: el'Nynaeve ti al'Meara Mandragoran
info: Young woman from Emond's Field, now an Aes Sedai of the Yellow Ajah. She was the Wisdom of her village, the youngest such ever chosen in Emond's Field. She left when four of her villagers were taken away from the Two Rivers by [Moiraine](#Moiraine-Damodred) and [Lan](#al-Lan-Mandragoran). While the group traveled away from her home and toward her new life, Nynaeve made several discoveries: she could channel the One Power, and had already done so without really knowing what she was doing; she developed feelings for Lan Mandragoran, Moiraine's Warder and the uncrowned king of the now dead nation Malkier; and she has a major role to play, as all of her younger friends in the group do, in the years to come. She is very strong in the One Power; only a select few who were alive during the Age of Legends could match her as well as a few young women still being trained. When she arrived in Tar Valon, she was raised Accepted without any tenure as a novice, despite not being able to even _sense_ the True Source unless angry, a result of her having to learn some minimal control of her ability without teaching. She was sent on a false mission by [Liandrin](#Liandrin) on which she was almost leashed by the Seanchan as [Egwene](#Egwene-al-Vere) was. After she returned to the Tower, [Siuan Sanche](#Siuan-Sanche) sent her on a mission to hunt down Liandrin and her fellow Black Sisters; while hunting them in Tanchico, she encountered [Moghedien](#Moghedien) and managed to better her in a duel of the Power. Moghedien escaped, but two encounters later Nynaeve once again managed to get the better of her, leashing her with an _a'dam_ in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Nynaeve took Moghedien with her to seek out [Rand](#Rand-al-Thor) and [Rahvin](#Rahvin) while they were fighting each other, and at the last moment before Rahvin might have won, she nearly burned Rahvin to ash with a giant weave of fire that was most of what Moghedien could draw to produce it; the distraction was enough for Rand to regain control of himself and destroy Rahvin with balefire. Nynaeve then kept Moghedien under control with a modified _a'dam_ in Salidar until [Halima](#Halima-Saranov) helped her escape. Nynaeve wished to become Aes Sedai for the sole purpose of Healing; she thinks the Tower meddles in the affairs of nations far too much, and wants no part of it. She is determined to Heal anything short of death, and has already managed to Heal gentling. Nynaeve felt bad when Moiraine died, because her first thought was not of her, but that now Lan was free from their bond. She was not told that Lan's bond had been passed to [Myrelle](#Myrelle-Berengari) at the moment of Moiraine's death. She and Lan are now married, and the plan is for Lan's bond to pass to her as soon as she and Myrelle can get together. She now wears the _ki'sain_, an ornament traditionally worn by Malkieri wives, consisting of a dot on the forehead between the eyes—Lan did not tell her of this tradition, but when she found out she immediately took it up. It is the one element of her appearance that never fades for one second when every other part changes faster than the eye can follow in _Tel'aran'rhiod_. Because she was the only person Rand felt he could trust to link with him and the Choedan Kal, he asked Nynaeve to assist him when he cleansed _saidin_. She now carries the _ter'angreal_ she found in Ebou Dar nearly all the time, making her collection of jewelry rival that of [Cadsuane](#Cadsuane-Melaidhrin). She is even rumored to leave much of this jewelry on even when sleeping.
